intro: Kadua centranthoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian bignay, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a rough texture. Kadua centranthoides is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in lowland forests.
